body_html:
No, if you replace the values you'll understand what's happening.
For example, try this: elems = tf.constant(((10, 2, 3), (-10, 2, -1)), dtype=tf.int64)
It will output [ 20 -20].
As you can see, when using constants map_fn thinks you want to apply the lambda function to the vectors, not the matrix. Not sure it's an expected behavior though.

As you can see, when using constants map_fn thinks you want to apply the lambda function to the vectors, not the matrix.  Not sure it's an expected behavior though.
body:
No, if you replace the values you'll understand what's happening. 
For example, try this:  `elems = tf.constant(((10, 2, 3), (-10, 2, -1)), dtype=tf.int64)`
It will output `[ 20 -20]`.
As you can see, when using constants `map_fn` thinks you want to apply the lambda function to the vectors, not the matrix.  Not sure it's an expected behavior though.
